alert.note: Alert for Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands; Bent County Including Las Animas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 3:46AM MDT until April 09 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM today for strong winds and low relative humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 222, 224, 226 through 233, 235 and 237...which includes the San Luis Valley, the I-25 corridor, and Crowley, Otero, Bent, Las Animas and Baca Counties... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issue from Sunday morning through Sunday evening for gusty winds and low humidity value for fire weather zones 221...222...224...226...227...228...229... 230...231...232 AND 233...which includes Fremont county, all of the I-25 corridor region, Crowley and Otero counties and the San Luis Valley... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND HIGH HAINES INDICES FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 235 AND 237... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 235 and 237. * Winds...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Timing...until 7 PM this afternoon, 11 AM through 9 PM Saturday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 6 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands; Bent County Including Las Animas
